title.narrative: Preservation of a Late 12th-Century Rock-Hewn Church at Lalibela

description.narrative: To support the preservation of Biet Gabriel Rafael, a hypogean (rock-hewn) church dating from the end of the 12th century at the archaeological site of Lalibela in northern Ethiopia. One of 11 such churches carved from solid rock and connected by underground passages and caverns, Biet Gabriel Rafael is at risk of irreversible damage from geological and structural stone fractures and water infiltration. This project involves a suite of non-invasive interventions to repair the most serious structural weaknesses, waterproof where necessary, and preserve and repair the damages to stone surfaces.

title.narrative: Enhancing National and Local Capacities for the Prevention of Trafficking in Persons and Protection of Victims of Trafficking and Vulnerable Returnees in Ethiopia

description.narrative: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) seeks to contribute to the Government of Ethiopias efforts in the prevention of trafficking in persons and the protection of victims. The project will build on and sustain government and local community structures and initiatives by implementing participatory awareness and capacity building activities through the continuation of the community dialogue forums. The community dialogue methodology will continue to enhance awareness about the concepts and risks associated with human trafficking and smuggling that will lead to meaningful attitudinal and behavioral change. Specific activities will include the monitoring and evaluation of local community dialogue groups; revisions to the TIP manual used by community dialogue facilitators to respond to the changing tactics employed by traffickers, as well as key provisions of amended labor migration and recently passed anti-trafficking law; the development of localized strategies and action plans to combat human trafficking; and the provision of economic reintegration support to trafficking survivors and vulnerable migrants who have returned to Ethiopia. The project will be implemented in partnership with the National Anti-Trafficking Task Force and Regional Anti-Trafficking Task Forces in the Amhara, Oromiya, Tigray and Southern Nations Nationalities and Peoples (SNNP) regions.
